name: James Gettys Hotel

reviews.text: The James Gettys Hotel is a delightful, homey, friendly, immpecable and incredibly convenient. When we park our car there we rarely move it for the whole weekend, whether it is to walk around the quaint town or visit the beautfuful college campus. This is a very special little hotel.
reviews.title: A hotel we stay in three times a year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was great, very clean and offered everything we needed for a quick weekend getaway! Breakfast was great.... Grapes, cantaloupe, homemade blueberry muffins and lemon bread, it was great! Very accommodating for late night arrival. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is because the hotel walls are pretty thin....you can hear everyone talking through surrounding walls. Other than that, it was a great time!
reviews.title: Sign of the buck

reviews.text: At first I was worried about going to a smaller hotel/inn/bed and breakfast after I gotta livingsocial deal for $101 a night at this hotel because I was expecting a small cramped dark room with no Tv but my worries were completely unnecessary. Our suite (all the rooms in the hotel are suites that are uniquely furnished...) was bright and large. It had a seperate bedroom and a living room/kitchenette area, in addition with a large private bathroom. The room was also exceptionally clean. The kitchenette was well stocked with dinnerware, glassware, and freshly ground coffee as well as some teas. The breakfast tray was pretty good but the one day I bit into a muffin and there was a pocket of salt or baking soda that wasn't mixed in so that was a bit disgusting but otherwise the breakfasts were okay. Nice big bathtub. The innkeeper, Katherine was really nice, talkative, and helpful. The room didn't have a safe, even though we didn't care I know that some people would have liked that. The location was pretty good.
reviews.title: excellent inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I will definitely return to the James Gettys Hotel. We were pleasantly surprised by the fresh & tasty home baked goods, chocolates, fruit, orange juice and cheese platter. The rooms were spotless and comfy. And, the staff went above and beyond making us feel like family. Love this place! We highly recommend it.
reviews.title: James Gettys Hotel is Top Notch!
Great stay in Gettysburg.
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the James Gettys Inn for an overnight recently, and we loved the location. The room was big and the decor was updated. In fact, they had said they recently renovated the room. The treats were a nice touch. The only negative was a little bit of road noise, which you would probably get anywhere in the downtown area. I would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: Best Place to Stay in Gettysburg
reviews.text: This was our 8th stay at the James Gettys. We first stayed here on a family trip in 2009. Now that our daughter goes to Gettysburg College we try to stay whenever we're in town.

The staff is very friendly. The rooms are clean and comfortable. And the breakfast has always been delicious. The best thing however is the location. We can park and walk to so many places, including the college which has been very convenient during busy times like move-in and parents weekend.
reviews.title: Wonderful Weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We cannot say enough good things about the hotel. We look forward to many more visits.
reviews.title: A great stay in the John Troxell Suite

reviews.text: Delightful B&B. Perfect location, within walking distance of the center of town and Gettysburg College. Wonderful staff, very friendly and helpful. Thank you for a wonderful weekend!
reviews.title: Nice B&B-Style hotel on busy main street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay in the John Troxell Suite. The suite was neat and clean and decorated in a great style. The included breakfast was lovely, the service excellent. I can recommend this to anyone.
reviews.title: Gettysburg Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed three nights at the James Gettys Hotel in Gettysburg and enjoyed it very much. All the rooms are suites, with a separate bedroom and a living area with a kitchenette. This made for very comfortable evenings, like having a home away from home. The comments in other reviews about street noise are true, but we were not particularly bothered by it. If you think this would be a problem I would book a room to the rear of the hotel.
reviews.title: Fun stay in Gettysburg

reviews.text: Our suite was perfectly clean and nicely decorated. The baked goods, fruit and juice left each evening for the following morning's breakfast were delicious. Finally, the entire staff was wonderful. Every person we met from reception to cleaning staff was cheerful and helpful. We would stay at the James Gettys again if we get back to Gettysburg.
reviews.title: Right in the center of it all!
Great stay
reviews.text: The James Gettys is a great place to stay! We were traveling with our two boys ages 11 and 13 and needed to have rooms that were next to each other. Every other hotel/ inn I called couldn't guarantee me that, but Stephanie at the James Gettys did!!
The all suite inn is quaint and centrally located to everything in Gettysburg! Many attractions wee within walking distance.
reviews.title: Consistently Excellent

reviews.text: The rooms were clean, nicely appointed and had kitchenettes! They provided fresh cream, butter, muffins, bread and coffee in the room for us to eat in the morning!
reviews.title: Not just a hotel room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed at the James Getty Hotel. It is the cleanest place I have ever had the pleasure of staying in. The mini- suite was lovely, with a small living area, and separate bedroom. There was a cheese platter waiting for us, along with various muffins, cakes, fruit, milk, and orange juice for the morning. We had a kitchenette with a refrig and coffee maker, which was just perfect. The staff was delightful, always a friendly smile, and very willing to accomodate any request. It's location couldn't have been better, right off the square, and close to everything. And, there's free parking in the back. It has been modernized, but is still very quaint. Loved it, and would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.text: We Have a daughter at the college so this is not our first time in Gettysburg. The downtown location was perfect for walking to campus and restaurants. Our suite had a wonderful sitting room where we could all gather on a drizzly day.
reviews.title: Great location - home away from home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was wonderful, the breakfast coffee cake was homemade and delicious. A wonderful change from a standard hotel room.
reviews.title: Great hotel = great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay at the James Gettys Hotel. The hotel is well located and our room was clean and spacious. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the muffins and bread at evening turndown service were delicious. Although meant for breakfast the following morning, some became midnight snacks.
reviews.title: Fabulous gem of a hotel

reviews.text: We were lured here by a Living Social coupon and were wowed by our stay. Located in the heart of downtown Gettysburg, this is a boutique hotel. Fresh muffins develivered to your room every morning; ours was a 2 room suite with a kitchenette - spacious and comfortable. free wifi, parking, etc. . Near al lthe attractions and restaurants. Highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Quaint Hotel

description: The James Gettys Hotel is an all-suite boutique hotel with the personality of a traditional bed and breakfast. This historic property offers twelve tastefully-appointed modern suites, each with a bedroom, comfortable sitting room, kitchenette and private bath. Whether you stay a day or a week, our commitment to each guest is the same; we offer a relaxing atmosphere and friendly services that will aid you in experiencing all that Gettysburg has to offer. Details like our home baked continental breakfast basket, packets of freshly ground French roast coffee and spa-quality toiletries will help you greet each day with renewed spirits. Come see why so many call the James Gettys Hotel their home away from home!
